body: As malaria programmes seek elimination, consistent quality of work is essential, particularly for detecting, confirming, treating, tracking and reporting on malaria cases. The core of this work is preparation of standard operating procedures and training, including re-training and continuing education, and supervision, including monitoring of performance. Various examples of guidance for ensuring the quality of care in health service delivery are available on the WHO website. Specific guidance for malaria programmes emphasizes high-quality laboratory testing for malaria (30).
title: 2.5.1 Quality assurance
